text:
Dear all,

Given the significance and urgency of what is being done in the different teams, I think we need to use additional means of boosting awareness of our activities to get out more information to the general public and attract additional, like-minded people in a short time.

I think one efficient way to complement ongoing awareness creation efforts, esp to attract people to help us, would be to leverage already well established and popular mass media and news sites, which can also reach 100s of thousands of followers on many platforms.

To this end:

1. Ethiotube has been contacted and has offered willingness to cooperate on this. Our own Mike Endale has been contacted by an Ethiotube staff. We can arrange awareness creation interviews, share videos, and other contents. If you have additional suggestions or contacts, please share them.

<https://slack-redir.net/link?url=http%3A%2F%2F2.In|2. >We can write introductory articles or short news items regarding a general overview of the activities and send them to online news media who have wide readership both in Ethiopia and abroad. Anyone who can write a few paragraphs on any issue regarding the team is welcome to share a workable draft on google doc. please also indicate if there is already something done on this.

( I have checked that google queries of "Ethiopia COVID-19 Response Team" or "Ethiopia COVID-19 Emergency Task Team" do not yield immediate results on the title, which is not a good sign of being visible.)

regards, Yonas.

Dear all,

Given the significance and urgency of what is being done in the different teams, I think we need to use additional means of boosting awareness of our activities to get out more information to the general public and attract additional, like-minded people in a short time.

I think one efficient way to complement ongoing awareness creation efforts, esp to attract people to help us, would be to leverage already well established and popular mass media and news sites, which can also reach 100s of thousands of followers on many platforms.

To this end:

Ethiotube has been contacted and has offered willingness to cooperate on this. Our own Mike Endale has been contacted by an Ethiotube staff. We can arrange awareness creation interviews, share videos, and other contents. If you have additional suggestions or contacts, please share them.

We can write introductory articles or short news items regarding a general overview of the activities and send them to online news media who have wide readership both in Ethiopia and abroad. Anyone who can write a few paragraphs on any issue regarding the team is welcome to share a workable draft on google doc. please also indicate if there is already something done on this.

( I have checked that google queries of "Ethiopia COVID-19 Response Team" or "Ethiopia COVID-19 Emergency Task Team" do not yield immediate results on the title, which is not a good sign of being visible.)

regards, Yonas.

text: In addition to those ideas, I think we should reach out to owners of different channels and groups on telegram since these channels have become one of the frequently visited sites for a piece of decent information. so I believe using telegram channels and telegram groups can create awareness of our activities in different parts of Ethiopia.

elements.text: In addition to those ideas, I think we should reach out to owners of different channels and groups on telegram since these channels have become one of the frequently visited sites for a piece of decent information. so I believe using telegram channels and telegram groups can create awareness of our activities in different parts of Ethiopia.

text:
hey friends :wave::skin-tone-4: made these from emojis (my response to WHO/UN creative call) ... feel free to share/use as fit

attachments.title: Do Stay Home
attachments.text: Using only emojis I am creating a soothing scenery and communicating the need to stay home. - Salem Berhanu, Washington, DC.

attachments.title: Cover Up
attachments.text: Using only emojis I am communicating the need to cover up. - Salem Berhanu, Washington, DC.
